t: 1 Samuel 3
And*p the child Samuel ministered unto the Lord*s before Eli. And the word of the Lord*s was precious in those days; there was no open vision.
And*p it came to pass at that time, when Eli was laid down in his place, and his eyes began to wax dim, that he could not see;
And*p ere the lamp of God went out in the temple of the Lord,*s where the ark of God was, and Samuel was laid down to sleep;
That*p the Lord*s called Samuel: and he answered, Here am I.
And*p he ran unto Eli, and said, Here am I; for thou calledst me. And he said, I called not; lie down again. And he went and lay down.
And*p the Lord*s called yet again, Samuel. And Samuel arose and went to Eli, and said, Here am I; for thou didst call me. And he answered, I called not, my son; lie down again.
Now*p Samuel did not yet know the Lord,*s neither was the word of the Lord*s yet revealed unto him.
And*p the Lord*s called Samuel again the third time. And he arose and went to Eli, and said, Here am I; for thou didst call me. And Eli perceived that the Lord*s had called the child.
Therefore*p Eli said unto Samuel, Go, lie down: and it shall be, if he call thee, that thou shalt say, Speak, Lord;*s for thy servant heareth. So Samuel went and lay down in his place.
And*p the Lord*s came, and stood, and called as at other times, Samuel, Samuel. Then Samuel answered, Speak; for thy servant heareth.
And*p the Lord*s said to Samuel, Behold, I will do a thing in Israel, at which both the ears of every one that heareth it shall tingle.
In*p that day I will perform against Eli all things which I have spoken concerning his house: when I begin, I will also make an end.
For*p I have told him that I will judge his house for ever for the iniquity which he knoweth; because his sons made themselves vile, and he restrained them not.
And*p therefore I have sworn unto the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eli's house shall not be purged with sacrifice nor offering for ever.
And*p Samuel lay until the morning, and opened the doors of the house of the Lord.*s And Samuel feared to shew Eli the vision.
Then*p Eli called Samuel, and said, Samuel, my son. And he answered, Here am I.

And*p he said, What is the thing that the Lord*s hath said unto thee? I pray thee hide it not from me: God do so to thee, and more also, if thou hide any thing from me of all the things that he said unto thee.
And*p Samuel told him every whit, and hid nothing from him. And he said, It is the Lord:*s let him do what seemeth him good.
And*p Samuel grew, and the Lord*s was with him, and did let none of his words fall to the ground.
And*p all Israel from Dan even to Beerâ€“sheba knew that Samuel was established to be a prophet of the Lord.*s
And*p the Lord*s appeared again in Shiloh: for the Lord*s revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of the Lord.*s
